DOCNAME: CASE OF MOREIRA DE AZEVEDO v. PORTUGAL
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected (non-exhaustion);Violation of Art. 6-1;Just satisfaction reserved
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON , who is a NORP national and resides at FAC , is a bus driver .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE CARDINAL of his brothers - in - law , Mr PERSON , shot him in the head following a family quarrel . The applicant was rushed to the São João de Porto hospital where he remained until DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the police arrested the suspect and communicated the facts to ORG , who requested the investigating judge of ORG to question him .

ORG Since there was insufficient evidence to establish the offence of attempted murder , the investigating judge ordered , on DATE , the provisional release of PERSON , subject to the lodging of a security of QUANTITY . He also decided to transmit the file to ORG for the inquiry to be continued .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE and DATE the applicant was examined by an ear , nose and throat specialist and an opthalmologist .

CARDINAL . ORG As ORG informed him that the applicant could not be examined until DATE , ORG entrusted this task to the court medical officer , who was invited to express an opinion in particular as to whether the assailant had acted with " the intention of causing death " .

CARDINAL . ORG In a report dated CARDINAL DATE , the medical officer concluded that the applicant had recovered and that the period during which he had been unfit for work was the period already established . He also expressed the opinion that the assailant had indeed intended to kill .
CARDINAL . ORG In the light of this report , ORG communicated the file to the investigating judge on CARDINAL DATE , requesting him to open the preliminary investigation .

The file was transferred to ORG ( tribunal de instrução criminal ) of ORG where it was registered on DATE .

He was deemed to have received it on DATE after its despatch ( LAW . CARDINAL of Legislative Decree No . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG In GPE criminal proceedings are in principle brought by ORG . According to LAW . DATE of DATE " criminal proceedings are the responsibility of the authorities ; they shall be brought by ORG subject to the restrictions provided for in the following Articles " . These restrictions relate to the cases in which the police or administrative authorities or other ORG organs may bring criminal proceedings , but they apply in general only for petty offences . Legislative Decree No . CARDINAL of DATE also states , in LAW thereof , that " except as provided for by law , criminal proceedings shall be conducted by ORG who shall open the preliminary inquiry or communicate the file to the investigating judge , as the case may be " .
CARDINAL . ORG In certain cases , private persons may participate in the criminal proceedings as assistentes . LAW Legislative Decree No . DATE provides as follows :
" The following may participate in proceedings as assistentes :
CARDINAL Those persons without whose accusation or complaint ORG can not bring a prosecution ;
CARDINAL The victims , namely those whose interests the criminal law sought especially to protect by prohibiting the offence ;
CARDINAL The husband in trials concerning offences of which his wife has been the victim , unless she objects thereto ;

CARDINAL The spouse , where there is no judicial separation or separation of property , or the surviving spouse or any ascendant , descendant , brother or sister , in cases where the victim is deceased or incapable of managing his or her own affairs ;
CARDINAL Any person in trials concerning embezzlement , bribery , misappropriation of public funds or corruption .
Para . CARDINAL - The assistentes perform the function of assistants to ORG ; their role in the proceedings is subordinate to that of ORG , except in cases provided for by the law .
Para . CARDINAL - However , the assistentes are entitled in particular :
CARDINAL to make prosecution submissions independently of those filed by ORG ;
CARDINAL to intervene directly in the adversarial investigation proceedings by adducing evidence and requesting the judge to take the appropriate measures ;
CARDINAL to appeal against the order committing the accused for trial , the judgment or the order terminating the proceedings , even if ORG has not done so .
Para . CARDINAL - ... ( repealed )

ORG . CARDINAL - In cases where the assistentes make prosecution submissions relating to facts different from those which are the subject of the prosecution submissions filed by ORG , they may not appeal against the decision of the court if it accepts LAW submissions .
ORG . CARDINAL - The assistentes may intervene at any moment in the proceedings DATE before the trial hearing and shall accept the state of the proceedings as they stand at that stage . "
The preamble to the LAW states as follows :

" CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings shall be brought by ORG in his capacity as a ORG authority . The right to punish an offender is a right that belongs exclusively to the ORG and consequently private individuals may , in accordance with the law , assist in bringing a prosecution , but have no personal right to bring one ... . "

Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure provides that the preliminary investigation is to be secret . However , according to paragraph CARDINAL thereof the accused and the assistente may have access to certain documents in the file provided that this does not impede the discovery of the truth .
CARDINAL . ORG LAW applicable at the material time - new provisions came into force with effect from DATE - contained several provisions on the victim ’s right to compensation :

" A claim for damages resulting from a punishable offence for which the perpetrators are liable must be brought in the criminal proceedings in process and may be brought in separate proceedings in the civil courts only in the cases provided for by this Code " .

" Except in the cases in which criminal proceedings may be brought only on the basis of a complaint or an accusation by a private party , civil proceedings may be instituted separately in the civil courts where the prosecution has not been brought by ORG within DATE of the complaint being laid or where no action has been taken on the complaint for the same period , where the proceedings have been discontinued or where the accused has been acquitted .

Para . CARDINAL In cases in which criminal proceedings may be brought only on the basis of a complaint or an accusation by a private party , the victim may bring civil proceedings , but if he does so , the criminal proceedings shall lapse .

Para . CARDINAL Where criminal proceedings have been instituted , civil proceedings may be brought separately only where no action has been taken in the criminal proceedings for DATE or more through no fault of the assistente where the proceedings have been discontinued or where the accused has been acquitted . "
" The claim for damages may be lodged in criminal proceedings even by a person who has not intervened as an assistente .

Para . CARDINAL The Public Prosecutor shall seek damages on behalf of the ORG , where appropriate , and on behalf of bodies serving public interests or the legally incapacitated to whom compensation is payable , if they are not represented by a lawyer in the proceedings .
Para . CARDINAL The statement of claim for damages shall be set out in articles .
Para . CARDINAL The evidence relating to the award of damages shall be adduced within the time - limits applying for the criminal proceedings ... "
" If the accused is convicted , the court shall decide the amount to be paid to the victims in respect of damages , even where no claim has been lodged .
Para . CARDINAL In cases where the law accords civil compensation to other persons the amount shall be determined for each party .

Para . CARDINAL The amount of compensation shall be determined at the discretion of the court which shall take into account the seriousness of the offence , the pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage and the financial and social position of the injured party and of the offender .

Para . CARDINAL The persons entitled to compensation may request , before judgment is pronounced at first instance , that the amounts of compensation be decided in enforcement proceedings . In such circumstances assessment and enforcement shall take place in the civil courts , the criminal judgment serving as the basis for enforcement .

ORG . CARDINAL If , in the cases provided for by law , the civil action for damages is pending or has been judged in the civil courts , compensation shall not be determined in the criminal proceedings . "
LAW Legislative Decree No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , cited above , states moreover as follows :
" In cases where the accused is acquitted , the court shall order the accused to pay damages in respect of proven unlawful acts or liability based on risk , if established .
In such cases LAW Procedure shall apply , adapted as necessary . "

CARDINAL . ORG In a " ruling " judgment ( assento ) of CARDINAL DATE ORG held that the civil courts had no competence to award compensation if compensation had already been awarded in the criminal proceedings ( PERSON , Series CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) .
Although this decision concerned civil and criminal damages for road traffic infringements , it set out the following general considerations :

" LAW [ of LAW ] establishes the principle of the interrelation ... between the criminal and the civil proceedings but with greater emphasis on the priority of the criminal proceedings over the civil proceedings ...

... The formulation of prosecution submissions in the criminal proceedings , which are intended to secure the conviction of the accused , can therefore be seen as implying a request for compensation to be awarded to the victim , because according to the law such compensation is a consequence of a conviction .
... the amount of compensation is determined by the criminal judgment regardless of whether the victim has filed a civil claim ... . "
